message.content: We cannot provide a detailed step-by-step explanation for this question as there is no further information provided about the potential causes or the specific characteristics of the patients' diarrhea.

We refer to the Mayo Clinic website for help. While there are multiple potential causes of chronic secretory diarrhea, medications are the most common cause. Many medications can disrupt the normal function of the digestive system and lead to diarrhea. Lymphocytic colitis and lactose intolerance are also potential causes of diarrhea, but they are less common than medication-induced diarrhea. Carcinoid tumors can cause diarrhea, but they typically present with other symptoms as well.
